definitions.definition: used as a polite way of addressing a man whose name you do not know, for example in a shop or restaurant

examples.text: Good morning, sir. Can I help you?
Are you ready to order, sir?
‘Thank you very much.’ ‘You're welcome, sir. Have a nice day.’

definitions.definition: used at the beginning of a formal business letter when you do not know the name of the man or people that you are dealing with
a title that is used before the first name of a man who has received one of the highest British honours (= a knight), or before the first name of a baronet
used as a form of address to a man in a position of authority, especially in the armed forces
used as a form of address by children in school to a male teacher

examples.text: Please, sir, can I open a window?
We will never allow that to happen! No sir!

definitions.definition: used to emphasize that something is true

examples.text: That's a fine car you have. Yes sir!

wordOrigin: Middle English: reduced form of sire.
